sentences.english: Little rod-like bacteria were found by chance to swim together in the direction of north .
sentences.chinese: 偶然发现小杆状细菌具有共同朝北游弋的现象。

sentences.english: A dwarf minke whale swims near Australia's Great Barrier Reef .
sentences.chinese: 一头小须鲸正在澳大利亚大堡礁附近游弋。

sentences.english: The two dragons swam in between, leisurely and sea.
sentences.chinese: 两条龙游弋于云海之间，悠然自得。

sentences.english: Five dragon swam in between, leisurely and sea.
sentences.chinese: 五条龙游弋于云海之间，悠然自得。

sentences.english: Several warships are cruising around the Mediterranean Sea.
sentences.chinese: 几艘军舰正在地中海上游弋。

sentences.english: You ask me: was it cold to swim alone in darkness?
sentences.chinese: 一个人在黑暗里游弋，你问我怕不怕？

sentences.english: Living in the water, the feeling comfortable cruising.
sentences.chinese: 临水而居，任心情自在游弋。

sentences.english: Our warship was cruising on the Pacific.
sentences.chinese: 我们的兵舰在太平洋上游弋。

sentences.english: There was a fishpond full of golden koi .
sentences.chinese: 还有一个鱼池，满池游弋着金黄色的鲤鱼。

sentences.english: Krill swam with the plankton , a school of young menhaden swam after the krill.
sentences.chinese: 磷虾游弋其中，后面跟着一大群鲱鱼。

sentences.english: Sometimes the southern Med’s main export has seemed to be boatloads of illegal immigrants.
sentences.chinese: 南地中海的主要港口经常游弋着载满非法移民的船只。

sentences.english: Take any ice-cold air molecule milling around my kitchen.
sentences.chinese: 就以我家厨房里游弋的任何一个冷空气分子为例吧。

sentences.english: A group of wealthy friends are cruising the sea near Sicily on a yacht.
sentences.chinese: 一群有钱人开着游艇在西西里岛附近的海上游弋。

sentences.english: More than 1000 single shell ships of fail-safe system are used everywhere in the world.
sentences.chinese: 安全系数脆弱的一千多艘单壳船，仍在世界各地游弋。

sentences.english: One howls on the prairie and one prowls on the hairy.
sentences.chinese: 一个是在高原上嚎叫，一个是在毛发里游弋。

definition: to move about/to go from place to place/roving/mobile
to wander/to roam about/to loaf about/to be idle
to travel back and forth/to shuttle
variant of 飄盪|飘荡[piao1 dang4]
to spiral/to circle/to go around/to hover/to orbit
to go through/to bore through/to push one's way through
to float/to hover/also written 漂浮
to drift/to wave/to float on the waves/to flutter in the wind
to float/to hover/to drift (also fig., to lead a wandering life)/to rove/showy/superficial
to float/to drift/to wander/variant of 蜉蝣[fu2 you2]
